titleStmt.title: J. R. Botts et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10505

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To His Excellency B Magoffin
Governor of the State of Kentucky

Your petitioners Citizens of Carter County would Respectfully Represent to your Excellency that at the last April Term of the Carter Circuit Court that David Floyd was find twenty Dollars for the offence of Illegal Gaming. They State that Mr Floyd is a hard working laboring man with a large Family Dependant on him for a support That he is not a Common gambler and will probably not offind again as he Seems to have been guilty without knowing the penalty of the offence he was Committing wherefore we pray that said fine may be Remitted
May 10th 1861

G T Oserton
H M, Floyed
Isaac Prewit
William Young
Jno. McGuire
L, H, Elliott
Gourdin
Samuel Snead
J, R, Botts
John T Shepherd
Abraham Anglin
S J England
G, W, Everman
W, A, Wamack
B W Ward
George Niethercut
Hary Curry
Stephen Nethercutt
Samuell Hubler
D M Vincent
B T Shepherd
Samuel Everman
Wm Bowling
J, W,
J. B. Ward
William Nethercutt
Mr Macy

Carter Cir. Ct
$20 } gaming
D Floyd
